Item.title: Animal bites
Item.Description:
Follow the emergency steps given in this section and contact a doctor immediately.
For detail description go to fullscreen mode.
Item.Content:
Follow the emergency steps given in this section and contact a doctor immediately.

  • Calm the affected person.
  • Wash hands before attending to wound.
  • Wash wound with soap and running water.
  • Apply antibiotic ointment
  • Dress using sterile bandage.
  • Keep the injury elevated above the level of the heart (if possible) for a few minutes to slow swelling.
  • After first aid, medical treatment must be sought quickly.
  • Suturing may be required.
  • Tetanus booster / antibiotics required
  • Treatment depends on type / location of wound

Treatment of a Sting in the Skin

  • Remove the sting, if still present, with tweezers
  • Apply a cold compress to relieve pain and minimize swelling
  • Advise the casualty to see their own medical practitioner

Treatment of a Sting in the Mouth

  • Give the casualty ice to suck to minimize swelling
  • Contact the emergency service

Treatment of Snake Bites

  • Lay the casualty down, telling them to keep calm and still
  • Wash the wound thoroughly with soap and water, if possible
  • Immobilize the affected area 
  • Keep area slightly elevated
  • Apply cool compress/wet cloth to affected part
  • Apply a firm bandage 2-4 inches above bite to prevent venom from spreading and take care of any bleeding
  • Contact the emergency service immediately

In case of emergency from Insect Bites and Stings

  • Try to keep the person calm
  • Check the person's breathing
  • Remove constricting items, like rings, from finger/nose/ears
  • Do Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR)
  • Contact the emergency service immediately

Item.title: Bleeding Gums
Item.Description:
Follow the emergency steps given in this section and contact a doctor immediately.
For detail description go to fullscreen mode.
Item.Content:
Follow the emergency steps given in this section and contact a doctor immediately.

  • Apply pressure using ice-pack
  • Rinse your mouth with a Pinch of salt in lukewarm water
  • Rinse twice a day to reduce swelling
  • Consult a dentist if bleeding continues
  • Massage gums regularly
  • Reline poorly fitted dentures

Item.title: Heat Stroke
Item.Description:
Follow the emergency steps given in this section and contact a doctor immediately.
For detail description go to fullscreen mode.
Item.Content:
Follow the emergency steps given in this section and contact a doctor immediately.

  • Move the person to a shady place
  • Cool the person by sponging with wet towel
  • Apply ice packs
  • Water with electrolyte, fruit/vegetable juice, coconut water should be given
  • Patient should be allowed to take rest

Item.title: Toothache
Item.Description:
Follow the emergency steps given in this section and contact a doctor immediately.
For detail description go to fullscreen mode.
Item.Content:
Follow the emergency steps given in this section and contact a doctor immediately.

  • Use a floss to remove any particle lodged between teeth
  • Rinse your mouth with warm water
  • Applying clove oil on the tooth, or chew on a clove
  • An ice pack can be applied to the outside of the face
  • Crush a few fresh parsley leaves and fuse it with a little salt (optional), then put the mixture on the tooth that is aching
  • Apply natural Aloe Vera gel to pacify the tooth gum
  • Visit a dentist
